meanings.definition: Tending to incriminate or make someone appear guilty.
meanings.sent1: The incriminatory evidence pointed directly at the suspect.
meanings.sent2: The police found incriminatory documents at the crime scene.
meanings.sent3: The incriminatory video footage of the cat stealing treats went viral.
meanings.sent4: Her incriminatory gaze made him confess to eating the last cookie.
meanings.sent5: The incriminatory fingerprints on the weapon left no doubt of his involvement.

meanings.sent1: The incriminatory report raised suspicions among the investigators.
meanings.sent2: The incriminatory testimony of the witness was crucial in the trial.
meanings.sent3: The incriminatory photo of the dog with the missing shoe was hilarious.
meanings.sent4: His incriminatory silence in response to the question spoke volumes.
meanings.sent5: The incriminatory footprints in the mud led the detectives to the culprit.
